column4: you mean what it caused to happen? cause i don't remember the error in terminal but it was something like could not locate even though it was there. i wouldn't want to try it again because it sometimes stopped ubuntu booting, or it would auto boot in safe graphics and if it did ever boot normally then everything gets so slow and stops responding
a link to a wiki how to page?
um, i confused, that page just explains what a how to page is...    http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Howto
yup, thats the driver that totally wrecked natty, maverick and almost lucid aswell
im looking for that link that explains why its not supported...
the card used to be supported, but it just doesn't work
which generation of card? ati seems to be fine for me
weird, x800 should be stable enough
just want to confirm, you are running the open source driver, right?
you may check your xorg.conf (if exists), or /var/log/Xorg.?.log
I think fglrx doesn't support old cards any more
yes, x800 is the r300 family (radeon r5xx)
fglrx dropped support for r5xx and older years ago
I don't know, I don't touch nvidia at all
you may try your luck with radeonhd
yes, the #radeon people was quite helping, if you report info requested, they can fix it in days
